main event: An unidentified object was observed in Washington, D.C. on April 5, 1957.
interesting points: The sighting involved two objects observed for about 2 to 5 seconds., The objects turned east before disappearing., The report indicates possible explanations including balloon or aircraft but insufficient data for a clear conclusion., Another report in August 1957 described a silver or chrome cigar-shaped object maneuvering for about 30 minutes., A witness observed a stationary white light which then moved at an estimated speed of 1000 miles per hour.
sighted object: Two unidentified objects and other instances of lights in the sky
witness description: Mr ----, Chief of Maintenance Division, U.S. Weather Bureau
